intro: Paraholcoglossum, commonly known as the pink-flowered orchid, is a member of the Orchidaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant features showy, pink or purple flowers that bloom in clusters, often with a distinct fragrance. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil. Paraholcoglossum is appreciated for its ornamental value in horticulture.
